intro: Paphiopedilum lowii var. marianum, commonly known as the Marianum Lady's Slipper, is a rare and striking orchid native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It is characterized by its unique, intricate flower structure, featuring a distinctive slipper-shaped pouch that serves as a pollination trap. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are dark green and革质 (leathery), providing a sturdy structure for photosynthesis. This variety is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts due to its beauty and limited distribution.
